text: `Next thing ${pick} knows`
`${pick} is put up in a bunk bed`
`looking at the ceiling. ${pick} touches the ceiling with hands`
`first time feeling trapped inside`
`digital alarm starts ringing. pitch is getting higher and higher`
`walks down the ladder to turn off the alarm`
`${pick} looks through clothes in suitcase and picks an outfit`
`goes to orientation and meets with other students who are also new to school and the states`
`${pick} is in the 7th grade`
`in this new place, new environment, new house`
`${pick} must get along with others and make this place home`
`thrown into this new world`
`${pick} might like it`
`might love it`
`might hate it`
`since being part of the community, ${pick} is required to do anything the school asks for`
`${pick} is not alone,`
`but definitely feels alone`
`the white wooden fence keeps ${pick} inside the school`
`its everywhere`
`fences are not tall, but they have sharp, pointy tops`
`Someone asks, do you translate when you hear English? Or do you understand it right away?`
`${pick} says, ‘I don’t know’`
`one asks again, well then do you think in English or in ${lang}?`
`And ${pick} replies, I just say it`
`${pick} thinks about this for a while`
`${pick} goes to American history class`
`${pick} has a quiz today`
`the quiz is on the current event that was discussed during class`
`fails it miserably`
`${pick} doesn’t know what to tell to parents because everyone else seems to be doing fine`
`maybe ${pick} is not the brightest kid after all`
`It’s a break time`
`${pick} sees other kids going outside. ${pick} looks out the window from the second floor. `
`${pick}'s never seen a grass field as large as this`
`${pick} thinks -i will stick out even more if i go out there -`
`other kids are playing touch football and basketball on mini hoop.`
`as of now, ${pick} doesn’t have a friend to talk to during a break.`
`${pick} is not sure what to do, but just stares out the window. And ${pick} wonders what are the rules for football`
`people think ${pick} is a shy`
`${pick} is not shy. it's just taking a while for ${pick} to adjust to the environmment.`
`it's break time again.`
`${pick} misses talking to old friends. so ${pick} turns on a computer.`
`${pick} tries to go on a ${lang} portal to use ${lang} email account. `
`however, except for some english words, all the characters are broken.`
`so ${pick} goes on another ${lang} portal and then types the ${lang} character in english.`
`'wkfwlso?'`
`on the bottom of the page, the portal asks if ${pick} meant to say 'How are you?' `
`finally ${pick} can send an email to an old friend with a little bit of hack`
`after school, before going to bed, ${pick} can use the cord-less home phone `
`but ${pick} needs to take turns when using a phone.`
`time is limited to 30 minutes since there are more than 15 kids to share the phone.`
`after recieving an email from a friend from home, ${pick} feels alive.`
`every day, after school and sports, ${pick} sees 'friends' getting picked up by the drive way`
`${pick} wonders what they might do when they go back home`
